intro: Calylophus hartwegii var. filifolia, commonly known as the threadleaf calylophus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers. The plant has narrow, thread-like leaves that give it its common name, and it typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. It is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in full sun and with minimal water requirements. Calylophus hartwegii var. filifolia is a low-growing shrub that plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
